benchmark_details.name: WIT (Wikipedia-based Image Text Dataset for Multimodal Multilingual Machine Learning)
benchmark_details.overview: WIT is a curated dataset composed of 37.6 million image-text examples from 108 Wikipedia languages. It facilitates multimodal, multilingual learning and is used for pretraining multimodal models, particularly for tasks such as image-text retrieval.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide the largest multimodal dataset for pretraining and evaluating models in the multilingual space.

data.source: Extracted from Wikipedia articles and Wikimedia image links.
data.annotation: High-quality annotations verified through an extensive human-annotation process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the similarity between image-text pairs using cosine similarity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Recall@K values indicate better performance in retrieving relevant image-text pairs.
methodology.validation: Human validation confirmed high-quality image-text associations with 98.5% favorable judgments.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis across 100+ languages with 12K+ examples in each language.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data extracted from publicly available Wikipedia articles.
